intro: Reichenheimia stelzneri, commonly known as the Stelzner's reichenheimia, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its unique, woolly foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
